meanings.definition: Below the required number or strength.
meanings.sent1: The team felt understrength without their star player.
meanings.sent2: The army unit was understrength and struggled to defend the base.
meanings.sent3: The understrength picnic lacked enough sandwiches for everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her understrength voice couldn't reach the back of the auditorium.
meanings.sent5: The understrength bridge creaked under the weight of the heavy truck.

meanings.definition: Not having enough members or resources.
meanings.sent1: The understrength company couldn't keep up with orders.
meanings.sent2: The understrength staff worked extra hours to cover the shortage.
meanings.sent3: The understrength party ran out of snacks within minutes.
meanings.sent4: His understrength knowledge of the subject made the exam challenging.
meanings.sent5: The understrength boat struggled to stay afloat in the rough sea.
